content.text: Lately, I have been thinking about different obligations. For example, I consider adults must worry more about what politicians do, but I also should know what they do with the financial resources they get. Do I have to know a lot about everything that happens in my country? I surely don't have to, but I should be more interested and aware of aspects that could affect me shortly. For sure, I must be responsible for what has been established as my responsibility; for example, I must prepare for tests, deliver my homework on time, carry an ID with me at all times, drive with an adult present (since I am still underage), etc. Shall teenagers ignore the constitution, laws, and regulations in their countries? I don't think so. Should we be interested in becoming adults that will positively change the world? For sure!
